page.title: 14BUILDINGS OF INTEREST
page.content: Buildings of architectural interest in the area include the two churches, St. Mary's , Salford and St. Nicholas at Hulcote. St.Mary's, an early l3th Century structure having leaded windows and an unusual entrance porch the upper part of which being of wood. A Tudor Rose and two contemporary symbols are carved upon a wooden beam over the door. The date 1633 is carved on a rafter and is thought to refer to repairs done to the porch in that year. The 14th century church of St. Nicholas stands at the end of an avenue of lime trees. An interesting feature of the church is the nail studded door, the handle of which is inscribed "R.C." Rook Tree Farm House near the church was the Dower House of the vanished manor of Hulcote, a signpost indicates its wherabouts at the end of a lane.
